alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:22AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Campbell and northern Pittsylvania Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 522 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Climax, or near Chatham, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Altavista... Hurt... Chatham... Gretna... Mt Airy... Java... and Climax. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
